subclauses.title: Directive Prologues and the Use Strict Directive

entries.feature: Directive prologues; configurable enforcement of "use strict"
entries.notes: JS2IL recognizes directive prologues and (by default) requires a top-level "use strict" directive. For third-party CommonJS modules that omit the directive, the compiler can downgrade the missing prologue to a warning via --strictMode=Warn (or suppress via --strictMode=Ignore). JS2IL still compiles using strict-mode semantics; this option only changes reporting severity for the missing directive prologue.
